byline.original: By CARLOTTA GALL and FARAH SAMTI

abstract: Relatives, neighbors and friends of Seifeddine Rezgui, Tunisian student suspected of shooting 39 tourists at Imperial Marhaba hotel in Sousse, Tunisia, recall signs Rezgui was becoming more radicalized; attribute his change to people he met while attending college in Kairouan, town known as base for outlawed extremist Salafist movement called Ansar al-Shariah.
lead_paragraph: Seifeddine Rezgui, the Tunisian student who shot 39 tourists at a seaside hotel on Friday, was a break-dancer in his youth but turned to extremism while in college.

headline.main: Tunisian Gunman Showed Subtle Signs of Radicalization
headline.print_headline: Tunisian Gunman Showed Subtle Signs of Radicalization

snippet: Seifeddine Rezgui, the Tunisian student who shot 39 tourists at a seaside hotel on Friday, was a break-dancer in his youth but turned to extremism while in college.
